com.ca.mas.foundation

Class MAS

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ca.mas.foundation.MAS

  • public class MAS
extends java.lang.Object
    The top level MAS object represents the Mobile App Services SDK in its entirety. It is where the framework lifecycle begins, and ends if necessary. It is the front facing class where many of the configuration settings for the SDK as a whole can be found and utilized.

    • Method Detail

      • debug

        public static void debug()
        Turn on debug mode

      • start

        public static void start(@NonNull
                         android.content.Context context)
        Starts the lifecycle of the MAS processes. This will load the last used JSON configuration from storage. If there was none, it will load from the default JSON configuration file (msso_config.json).

      • start

        public static void start(@NonNull
                         android.content.Context context,
                         boolean shouldUseDefault)
        Starts the lifecycle of the MAS processes. This will load the default JSON configuration rather than from storage; if the SDK was already initialized, this method will fully stop and restart the SDK. The default JSON configuration file should be msso_config.json. This will ignore the JSON configuration in the keychain storage and replace it with the default configuration.
        Parameters:
        shouldUseDefault - Boolean: using default configuration rather than the one in storage.

      • start

        public static void start(@NonNull
                         android.content.Context context,
                         org.json.JSONObject jsonConfiguration)
        Starts the lifecycle of the MAS processes with the given JSON configuration data. This method will (if it is different) overwrite the JSON configuration that was stored.
        Parameters:
        jsonConfiguration - JSON Configuration object.

      • start

        public static void start(@NonNull
                         android.content.Context context,
                         java.net.URL url)
        Starts the lifecycle of the MAS processes with given JSON configuration file path. This method will (if it is different) overwrite the JSON configuration that was stored.
        Parameters:
        url - URL of the JSON configuration file path.

      • start

        public static void start(@NonNull
                         android.content.Context context,
                         java.net.URL url,
                         MASCallback<java.lang.Void> callback)
        Starts the lifecycle of the MAS processes with given JSON configuration enrolment URL or null. This method will overwrite JSON configuration (if they are different) that was stored in keychain when configuration file path or enrolment URL is provided. When URL is recognized as null, this method will initialize SDK by using last used JSON configuration that is stored, or load JSON configuration from defined default configuration file name.

        Enrolment URL is an URL from gateway containing some of credentials required to establish secure connection. The gateway must be configured to generate and handle enrolment process with client side SDK. The enrolment URL can be retrieved in many ways which has to be configured properly along with the gateway in regards of the enrolment process. MASFoundation SDK does not request, or retrieve the enrolment URL by itself.

        Parameters:
        url - The enrollment URL If the enrollment url is null, start(Context) will be used to start the lifecycle of the MAS processes..
        callback - The callback to notify when a response is available, or if there is an error.

      • invoke

        public static <T> long invoke(MASRequest request,
                              MASCallback<MASResponse<T>> callback)
        Request method for an HTTP POST, PUT, DELETE, GET call to the Gateway.
        Type Parameters:
        T - To provide the data type of the expected response object. The SDK converts the response stream data to the provided data type. By defining this generic type, it provides tighter type checks at compile time. Currently the SDK support 2 types of response objects.
        • application/json: JSONObject
        • text/plain: String
        Developers can define a response object type with MASRequest.MASRequestBuilder.responseBody(MASResponseBody) )}.
        Parameters:
        request - The request to send.
        callback - The callback to notify when a response is available, or if there is an error.
        Returns:
        The request ID.

      • setConfigurationFileName

        public static void setConfigurationFileName(java.lang.String filename)
        Sets the name of the configuration file. This provides the ability to set the file name to a custom value. To use a custom configuration name, you must call this method before start(Context), start(Context, boolean).
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the configuration file.

      • gatewayIsReachable

        public static void gatewayIsReachable(MASCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)
        Retrieves a boolean indicating if the gateway is currently reachable or not.

      • setConnectionListener

        public static void setConnectionListener(MASConnectionListener listener)
        Sets a listener to listen for connection events.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to listen for connection events.

      • setAuthenticationListener

        public static void setAuthenticationListener(MASAuthenticationListener listener)
        Set a user login listener to handle user authentication.
        Parameters:
        listener - The user login listener to handle user authentication.

      • isAuthenticationListenerRegistered

        public static boolean isAuthenticationListenerRegistered()
        Checks whether the consumer of MAS has set any authentication listener or not. This would help other frameworks to override the listener (and the login UI) as a fallback instead of default implementation of MASUI.
        Returns:
        boolean True if user has set an authentication listener, else false.

      • setGrantFlow

        public static void setGrantFlow(int type)
        Sets the grant type property. The default is MASConstants.MAS_GRANT_FLOW_CLIENT_CREDENTIALS.
        Parameters:
        type - Either MASConstants.MAS_GRANT_FLOW_CLIENT_CREDENTIALS or MASConstants.MAS_GRANT_FLOW_PASSWORD.

      • getContext

        public static android.content.Context getContext()

      • getCurrentActivity

        public static android.app.Activity getCurrentActivity()

      • cancelRequest

        public static void cancelRequest(long requestId)
        Cancels the specified request ID. If the response notification has not already been delivered by the time this method executes, a response notification will never occur for the specified request ID except MASRequest.MASRequestBuilder.notifyOnCancel() is set.
        Parameters:
        requestId - the request ID to cancel.

      • cancelRequest

        public static void cancelRequest(long requestId,
                                 android.os.Bundle data)
        Cancels the specified request ID with additional information. If the response notification has not already been delivered by the time this method executes, a response notification will never occur for the specified request ID except MASRequest.MASRequestBuilder.notifyOnCancel() is set.

        When MASRequest.MASRequestBuilder.notifyOnCancel is set, MASCallback.onError(Throwable) will be triggered with MAS.RequestCancelledException. The additional information can be retrieved with MAS.RequestCancelledException.getData()

        Parameters:
        requestId - the request ID to cancel.
        data - the additional information to the request.

      • cancelAllRequests

        public static void cancelAllRequests()
        Cancels all requests. If the response notification has not already been delivered by the time this method executes, a response notification will never occur, except MASRequest.MASRequestBuilder.notifyOnCancel() is set.

      • cancelAllRequest

        public static void cancelAllRequest(android.os.Bundle data)
        Cancels all requests with additional information. If the response notification has not already been delivered by the time this method executes, a response notification will never occur, except MASRequest.MASRequestBuilder.notifyOnCancel() is set.

        When MASRequest.MASRequestBuilder.notifyOnCancel is set, MASCallback.onError(Throwable) will be triggered with MAS.RequestCancelledException. The additional information can be retrieved with MAS.RequestCancelledException.getData()

        Parameters:
        data - the additional information to the request.

      • processPendingRequests

        public static void processPendingRequests()

        Requests that any pending queued requests be processed.

        This can be called from an activity's onResume() method to ensure that any pending requests waiting for an initial unlock code to be set on the device get a chance to continue.

        This method immediately returns to the calling thread.

        An activity may be started if a device lock code (still) needs to be configured or if the user must be prompted for a username and password.

      • getState

        public static int getState(android.content.Context context)
        Returns current MASState value. The value can be used to determine which state SDK is currently at.
        Returns:
        return MASState of current state.

      • enablePKCE

        public static void enablePKCE(boolean enablePKCE)
        Enable PKCE extension to OAuth.
        Parameters:
        enablePKCE - True to enable PKCE extension, False to disable PKCE Extension. Default to true.

      • isPKCEEnabled

        public static boolean isPKCEEnabled()
        Determines whether PKCE extension is enabled.
        Returns:
        true if PKCE extension is enabled, false otherwise

      • stop

        public static void stop()
        Stops the lifecycle of all MAS processes.

      • sign

        public static java.lang.String sign(MASClaims masClaims)
                             throws MASException
        Signs the provided JWT MASClaims object with the device registered private key using SHA-256 hash algorithm and injects JWT claims based on the user information. This method will use a default value of 5 minutes for the JWS 'exp' claim if not provided.
        Parameters:
        masClaims - The JWT Claims
        Returns:
        The JWT format consisting of Base64URL-encoded parts delimited by period ('.') characters.
        Throws:
        MASException - Failed to sign

      • sign

        public static java.lang.String sign(MASClaims masClaims,
                                    java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
                             throws MASException
        Signs the provided JWT MASClaims object with the provided RSA private key using SHA-256 hash algorithm and injects JWT claims based on the user information. This method will use a default value of 5 minutes for the JWS 'exp' claim if not provided.
        Parameters:
        masClaims - The JWT Claims
        privateKey - The private RSA key.
        Returns:
        The JWT format consisting of Base64URL-encoded parts delimited by period ('.') characters.
        Throws:
        MASException - Failed to sign

      • enableBrowserBasedAuthentication

        public static void enableBrowserBasedAuthentication()
        Enables Browser Based Authentication for authorization (set to false by default). Browser Based Authentication allows administrators to configure the login screen which will be rendered in the browser allowing users to log in.

      • isBrowserBasedAuthenticationEnabled

        public static boolean isBrowserBasedAuthenticationEnabled()
        Checks if is enabled or not for authorization (returns false by default).
        Returns:
        true if Browser Based Login is enabled and false otherwise
